intro: Colysis pothifolia var. membranacea, commonly known as the membranaceous colysis, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and small, clustered flowers. The leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in a thin, membranous layer, giving the plant its varietal name. It thrives in arid or semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky soils. Due to its limited distribution and unique morphology, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
